label: Folder 44: Newspaper Article 15
description: News and Courier article (Jan. 10, 1951), "Traffic Plan Changes to be Made This Month.  Charleston Evening post articles (Jan. 15, 1951), "Revised Traffic Plan to go Into Effect on Feb. 5" and "City Seeks Use of School Site for Parking."

Perry,  chairman of the traffic committee  of counci, said last night that  the aternative Smith-Dibbe traffic plan approved by Council in  December probably would be  made   effective   ater   this   month.  He said representatives of Smith  and Dibbe, Columbia traffic engineers, have been invited here to  go over detais of the changes, under which King street traffic will  move south instead of north and  Meeting street will revert to two-  way traffic.  "We expect the - engineers  to come this week or next," he  said, "Then we will iron out the  detais. The  plan  that ..wi become effective February 5 is Aternate". plan  No.. 2."  The change will mean that several hundred, parking  spaces in  King and Meeting streets "wi be  eiminated.  Parking, will be prohibited at a  times on the west side of Rutledge  from Mount  ; pleasant to- Race  street; on the West side of King  from Mount pleasant" to-Grove; on  the least side of King" from - Grove  to, Cannon, and , the least  side of  King "from Cannon to Calhoun.  also on the west side of-King  from Calhoun to Broad street, and  the least side of Meeting " from  Mount pleasant to Broad,-  loading ..zones within these  streets will .be suppied with parking meters. -  The city; will seek permission to  use the Memminger School property  as a parking ot.  This decision was reached today  in Mayor Morrison"s office as a city  Council Retai Merchants  Association  committee, -met to aunch plans" for  acquiring parking lots in the con-  g sted,  shopping   districts.  "The merchants," the, mayor said,  "were most enthusiastic about the  proposa. Our first step will be to  appear before-the city School board  and ask that this vauable.property  be used as a parking ot,  "Other off-street lots will be  sought just as rapidy as possibe.  We a realize the critica condition  existing today and that something  must be done immediatey to reieve  matters," the mayor added.  , He. said he will appoint four Additional members to the committee  Wednesday and the entire group  will probably meet again this week  or eary next week.
